name: Great Chases Quiz / Test | Classic Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: "To Catch a Thief" features a great car chase along winding Riviera roads as Cary Grant tries to elude the police. Who is driving the car being pursued?
questions.explanation:
Grace Kelly.

	One of Hitchcock's best.

questions.text: Hitchcock and Grant again: The image of Cary Grant running from a pursuing aircraft is quite memorable. What happens to the aircraft?
options: It is forced to flee the scene
It is shot down from the ground
It lands so that the occupants can pursue Grant on foot
questions.explanation:
It crashes and explodes.

	Memorable scene in a memorable movie - even without Mount Rushmore or the Statue of Liberty.

questions.text: "Bullitt" features Steve McQueen chasing (and being chased by) another car in one of the best chase scenes on film. How many people are in the other car?
questions.explanation:
2.

	Driver and gunman. Heck of a scene.

questions.text: "The French Connection" has another great chase. Who is the driver of the car that races wildly through the streets of New York in order to get to the subway station on time?

How about a chase scene involving an animal instead of a man? Who can forget the image of poor old King Kong climbing the Empire State Building while being pursued on land and in the air? Who accompanies him to the top of the building?
questions.explanation:
Fay Wray.

	Beauty and the Beast.

questions.text: In "High Sierra" Humphrey Bogart has to run for his life from the pursuing police. What does he do?
questions.correct: He tries to climb a mountain
options: He tries to get to the airport
He tries to outrun them in a car
He tries to escape by sea
questions.explanation:
He tries to climb a mountain.

	Don't forget the title of the movie.

questions.text: In "Fail Safe", the chase is in the air: can air force fighters catch up to the bomber? Henry Fonda plays the President; who plays his translator?
questions.explanation:
Larry Hagman.

	Hagman is fine in a small role. Matthau is the hawk and Weaver is the unstable soldier. Binns is the bomber pilot. Great movie, tough ending.

questions.text: "The Defiant Ones" is one big chase. Tony Curtis and Sidney Poitier are the stars; who is the director?
questions.explanation:
Stanley Kramer.

	Good movie. Rotten ending.

questions.text: The latter part of "The Great Escape" is filled with numerous chases of escaped prisoners. Steve McQueen's motorcycle attempt may be the most memorable. How does his attempted escape end?
questions.correct: He is recaptured and returned to the POW camp
options: He is killed during the attempted escape
questions.explanation:
He is recaptured and returned to the POW camp.

	Others flee by plane, boat, train, etc.

questions.text: "Sink the Bismarck" is also a sort of "chase" film. Where was the film made?
questions.explanation:
Great Britain.

	Kenneth More and Dana Wynter. Not bad.
